poem:
"A Fiscal Quandary"

Sunak, Sunak, in Parliament's light,
Where do young desires take flight?
Two daughters, nestled in nest soft,
Yet, National Service stands aloft.

Heed the young, in plea and stanza,
Your fiscal hand, the nation's panacea.
Parents stare at the murky depths,
How deep, Sunak, will be our breaths?

With power beheld and in command,
Will their futures be on sand?
